issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
The QA load pv image tests is failing due to EKI permission issues on some but not all systems.
The test appears the be setting launch perms to 'all' for the EMI but not the associated EKI, ERI the EMI is registered with. I don't believe the test has changed, and this used to work. 

Opening this to track what appears to be new behavior in the system:
- determine if this is inconsistent behavior across systems, or the tests are inconsistent
- if this is a change in euca launch permissions, determine if this needs to be addressed in docs and or upgrade procedures
- determine if this is a test issue. 

Thanks!
-M
fields.summary: PV images failing to run by non-euca-admin users due to EKI auth issues

comments.body:
This may have something to do with multi-cluster topologies, or a difference in the test sequences between MC and non-MC clouds (like timing)..

I've tested this on 5 clouds today.  2 non-multi-cluster and 3 multi-cluster. 
On 2 the 2 non-multicluster clouds I CAN run PV images as a non-euca-admin user as long as the launch permissions allow the EMI to be run by that user. The EKI and ERI have empty launch perms. 

On the remaining 3 clouds I CAN NOT run PV images while only the EMI has launch permissions. The user will get an error regarding  failure to look up the EKI. 

Still investigating...
Also worth noting that the non-multi-cluster  systems only have a single node.
[~mclark], what is the error message you see when it fails?
[~mclark], I have not been able to reproduce this issue. Do you have a 4.4 cloud that shows the problem?

Hi [~sjones], 
I've been able to reproduce on this cloud cloud 10.111.5.10 (multicluster + VPC). 4.4 but an older build. 

{code}

In [41]: images = user.ec2.connection.get_all_images(filters={'virtualization_type':'paravirtual'})
In [42]: images
Out[42]: 
[Image:emi-2a7b97f1,

[~mclark], 10.111.5.10 looks like a build from master, so not 4.4:

{code}
$ git branch -r --contains 57088d4 
  origin/HEAD -> origin/master
  origin/dev-ethomas-EUCA-13144
  origin/dev-sjones-euca-10773
  origin/dev-sjones-euca-13052
  origin/dev-sjones-euca-13158
  origin/dev-sjones-euca-13165
  origin/dev-sjones-euca-13173
  origin/dev-sjones-euca-13179
  origin/dev-sjones-euca-651
  origin/dev-spark-EUCA-13054
  origin/dev-spark-EUCA-13074
  origin/master
{code}
If this issue was only seen in master it may be a duplicate of EUCA-13179.

OSG is returning Access Denied for all parts in manifest.
From the OSG log
{code}
2017-04-05 11:02:13 DEBUG 000001145 PolicyEngineImpl         | Request is rejected by resource authorization check, due to decision DEFAULT
2017-04-05 11:02:13 DEBUG 000001145 PolicyEngineImpl         | com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: Access to the resource is denied
com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: Access to the resource is denied
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyEngineImpl.evaluateAuthorization(PolicyEngineImpl.java:285)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.Permissions.isAuthorized(Permissions.java:257)
	at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.auth.OsgAuthorizationHandler.iamPermissionsAllow(OsgAuthorizationHandler.java:335)
	at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.auth.OsgAuthorizationHandler.operationAllowed(OsgAuthorizationHandler.java:294)
{code}
[~sjones], I'd think the bug is related to the changes for EUCA-651.
[~sjones], looks like the issue in only for PV images. I am not sure what I've been doing differently before but now I can start IS image from a different account.
[~vasya], ok. Please describe how you reproduced the issue for PV images.

[~vasya], following those steps (but adding a keypair and updating the security group) I am able to run an instance and ssh to it:

{code}
#
#
# euare-accountlist

#

IMAGE	emi-26391f81	precise-server/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml	000085219562	available	public	x86_64	machine	eki-57b494b2	eri-d89f5efc		instance-store	paravirtual

# euca-import-keypair -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub root
KEYPAIR	root	89:7e:06:a8:34:31:92:4f:93:58:91:ad:16:4b:96:67
#
#
# euca-run-instances -k root emi-26391f81
RESERVATION	r-e76407bd	000376001843	default
INSTANCE	i-beced36f	emi-26391f81	euca-10-111-30-120.eucalyptus.a-34-l.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-30-131.eucalyptus.internal	pending	root	0		m1.small2017-04-05T23:36:58.176Z	one	eki-57b494b2	eri-d89f5efc		monitoring-disabled	10.111.30.120	10.111.30.131			instance-store					paravirtual			sg-492d935e				x86_64
#
#
# euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION	r-e76407bd	000376001843	default
INSTANCE	i-beced36f	emi-26391f81	euca-10-111-30-120.eucalyptus.a-34-l.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-30-131.eucalyptus.internal	running	root	0		m1.small2017-04-05T23:36:58.176Z	one	eki-57b494b2	eri-d89f5efc		monitoring-disabled	10.111.30.120	10.111.30.131			instance-store					paravirtual			sg-492d935e				x86_64
# 
# 
# euca-authorize -P tcp -p 22 default
GROUP	default
PERMISSION	default	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0
#

# ssh euca-10-111-30-120.eucalyptus.a-34-l.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
The authenticity of host 'euca-10-111-30-120.eucalyptus.a-34-l.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com (10.111.30.120)' can't be established.
ECDSA key fingerprint is 50:5b:5c:3f:71:c1:71:3d:54:81:3e:63:13:07:c3:7b.

Warning: Permanently added 'euca-10-111-30-120.eucalyptus.a-34-l.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com,10.111.30.120' (ECDSA) to the list of known hosts.
Welcome to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS (GNU/Linux 3.2.0-23-virtual x86_64)

Get cloud support with Ubuntu Advantage Cloud Guest
  http://www.ubuntu.com/business/services/cloud

root@euca-10-111-30-131:~# 
root@euca-10-111-30-131:~# exit
logout
Connection to euca-10-111-30-120.eucalyptus.a-34-l.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-syste closed.
#

{code}
[~vasya], yes, the above output is using a build from master/5.0.

I've re-tested on fresh build from 79ace4d2 and don't see the same error. I don't think there are any changes from 2a4219 build that I've used that would explain the difference. I need to dig more into this.
[~mclark], I can't reproduce this issue with the latest master.

[~vasya] I'm not able to reproduce in master atm either. Closing this as not reproducible. The PV test in CI should catch this if the behavior reverts, or this is intermittent behavior. 
Thanks!
-M
